chapterTitle: Financial Statements, Taxes, and Cash Flow

columns.text: In this problem, we will determine whether the formula for the net capital spending is equal to the formula for the gross fixed asset account

In order to do this, we must first understand the difference between the net fixed asset and the gross fixed asset. The **net fixed asset account** basically refers to the all the assets, contra assets, and liabilities of a certain company. On the other hand, the **gross fixed asset** refers to the amount of money that the company paid in order to acquire all the current assets.

Substituting the formula for the net fixed assets to the formula for capital spending, we will get:

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{NFA}_{\text{end}}-\text{NFA}_{\text{beginning}}+\text{Depreciation}&=(\text{FA}_{\text{end}}-\text{AD}_{\text{end}})-(\text{FA}_{\text{beginning}}-\text{AD}_{\text{beginning}})
\end{aligned}$$
